result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J. ALEXANDER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

No contact with T.A.N., the victim.

No contact with individuals under the age of 18 without agent's permission.

Comply with sex offender registry requirments.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information charging four counts of exposing child to harmful material, contrary to Section 948.11(2)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
NO CONTEST pleas entered to all four counts.  Convicted.
The Court orders a presentence investigation report to be completed by DOC and also orders the defendant to undergo a Psycho-Sexual Evaluation if the Departament finds it appropriate per statute.
PSI is due to the court by 08-07-15.
Sentencing is set for 08-14-15 at 1:30 p.m.
The Court orders a DNA sample to be taken.
Minutes.

Plea hearing is set for 06-08-15 @ 8:30 a.m.

Marcus Falk, through public defender.

Petition and Order to Withdraw as Counsel of Record.
It is hereby ordered, that Ann Larson be, and hereby is allowed to withdraw as counsel of record for the defendant aboved-named. A new attorney will be appointed by the office of the State Public Defender.

MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL - 
Attorney Larson has a conflict continuing with these cases.  The defendant is aware of this and is in agreement with Attorney Larson withdrawing.
The Court signs the order.  A copy of the order is given to defendant to take to the public defenders office.

ADDRESS INFO for Austin J. Alexander
Current: 1619 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 07-01-2014)
Prior: 1211 S. 22nd Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of use of a computer to facilitate a sex crime.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-21-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with T.A.N. DOB: 10-23-2001 or anyone under the age of 16 with the exception of his siblings and no contact with any internet enabled devices.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
